name: "Cheers" The Saga Continues Online Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 2 | 20 Questions

questions.text: In the first episode of season 2, called "Power Play" what does Diane say her stuffed giraffe is named?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Jammers

	Her bee was named Mr. Buzzer.

questions.text: Rhea Perlman played Carla's sister Annette in the episode entitled "Little Sister Don't Cha".
questions.explanation:
True.

	Rhea Perlman had the duel role of Annette and, of course, Carla.

questions.text: Which Shakespearean play do Andy and Diane enact a scene from in "Homicidal Ham"?
questions.explanation:
Othello.

	"Put out the light, and then put out the light."  Andy is in love with Diane, and wants to kill her when he catches Diane kissing Sam. But in all fairness, hasn't everyone at one time or another wanted to kill Diane?

questions.text: What book did Sam read to impress Diane in "Sumner's Return"?
questions.explanation:
War and Peace.

	Diane tells him there's a movie and he gets upset because he read the book for nothing.

questions.text: In "Affairs of the Heart" who is the man that Carla dates with the heart condition?
questions.explanation:
Hank.

	She spends the entire episode trying to find something wrong with him. However, at the end, she agrees to see him again.

questions.text: At the end of "Old Flames," the episode where Dave Richards says he can break Sam and Diane up in 24 hours, do they break up?
questions.explanation:
No.

	They come close to breaking up, but this time they stay together.

questions.text: What was Norm's nickname in high school?
questions.explanation:
Moonglow.

	Norm was a wrestler in high school.

questions.text: What does Sam tell Diane the only reason he's with her is in "How do I love thee...Let me Call You Back"?
options: I love the way your hair smells
questions.explanation:
I lu...I lu...

	Sam has never had trouble saying "I love you." Now, that he really means it, he can't say it. But he can say "Peter piper picked a peck of pickled peppers."

questions.text: What is the name of Diane's best friend in "Just Three Friends"?
questions.explanation:
Heather Landon.

	Heather Landon was played by Markie Post. She later starred in "Night Court" as Christine Sullivan.

questions.text: Which "Punky Brewster" star guest starred on "Cheers" in "Where There's a Will..."?
questions.explanation:
George Gaynes.

	Gaynes played Henry on "Punky". On "Cheers" he played a dying man named Malcolm.  In case you were wondering the other names are all from "Punky". Frye played Punky, Garrett played Mrs. Johnson, and Carter played Mike.

questions.text: Who does Nick marry in "Battle of the Exes"?
questions.explanation:
Loretta.

	Carla is Nick's ex-wife. Diane works in the bar and is sometimes dating Sam Malone. Seraphina is Carla and Nick's second child together.  Loretta was played by Jean Kasem. You might recognize her last name, her husband is Casey Kasem.

questions.text: How much money does Norm tell Sam he has coming back from the government?
questions.explanation:
$15,000.

	Sam used his original accountant instead of Norm because he was scared. Norm is angry that Sam didn't trust him however, but they make up and the friendship continues.

questions.text: In "Coachie Makes Three" where does the woman Coach likes, work?
questions.explanation:
bank.

	Coach: "Why do they call it interest, there's nothing interesting about it, in fact it's quite boring."

questions.text: Who does Cliff ask to take him to the hospital in "Cliff's Rocky Romance"?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Cliff wanted to prove to his friend's that he wasn't a coward, but actually a black belt in karate. He does this by kicking a piece of wood into two. One problem: He isn't a black belt in karate, and needs a doctor quickly.

questions.text: What fortune does Diane receive from the fortune telling scale Coach bought for the bar?
options: "You will one day be a beauty queen."
"Careful who you hurt, it shall come back three fold."
questions.explanation:
"Deception in romance proves costly."

	Diane went out with another guy, and they kissed. She hasn't told Sam this. She doesn't believe the fortunes are true until she gets hers.

questions.text: The weekend of what person's birthday, does Sam go skiing with his friends to pick up women according to Carla in "Snow Job"?
questions.explanation:
George Washington.

	Diane doesn't believe he'd really go away, and it turns out she's right.

questions.text: Sam has had affairs with his married friends' wives.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Sam: "I can't take all the credit for that though, most of my friends' wives are real ugos."

questions.text: Norm cheats on Vera.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The guys at the bar teased him and tried to get him to do it, but Norm loves Vera too much to cheat on her.

questions.text: In "I'll Be Seeing You Again - Parts I and II", who played Phillip Semenko?
questions.explanation:
Christopher Lloyd & Lloyd.

	Christopher Lloyd is best known for playing Rev. Jim in "Taxi" and Doc Brown in the "Back to the Future" trilogy.

questions.text: In "I'll Be Seeing You-Part II", the final episode of season 2, do Sam and Diane break up?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	This is one of the many times they have broken up.
